com.amazon.ags.api.whispersync.model
Interface SyncableDeveloperString

public interface SyncableDeveloperString

A syncable type that represents a string whose conflict resolution is handled by the developer. This type is typically used to represent a combination of associated values across multiple devices. The values should typically be serializable. An example is a player's basket that holds both coins and items purchased. Note that metadata cannot be associated with this type.

Method Summary
 long getCloudTimestamp()
          The time in which the cloud value of this element was set as the number of seconds elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.
 java.lang.String getCloudValue()
          Returns the value stored in the cloud of this SyncableDeveloperString.
 long getTimestamp()
          The time in which this element was set as the number of seconds elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.
 java.lang.String getValue()
          Returns the local value of this SyncableDeveloperString.
 boolean inConflict()
          Returns whether the local value of this SyncableDeveloperString conflicts with the value in the cloud.
 boolean isSet()
          Returns whether or not the value of this SyncableDeveloperString has been set, and thus inserted into the GameDataMap.
 void markAsResolved()
          Performs the conflict resolution once the developer has set the desired value.
 void setValue(java.lang.String value)
          Sets the value of this SyncableDeveloperString.
 

Method Detail

inConflict

boolean inConflict()
Returns whether the local value of this SyncableDeveloperString conflicts with the value in the cloud. If true, the cloud value is available using getCloudValue(). The developer is responsible for the resolution of conflicts.

Returns:
true when an unresolved conflict has occurred, false otherwise.

markAsResolved

void markAsResolved()
Performs the conflict resolution once the developer has set the desired value.

getCloudValue

java.lang.String getCloudValue()
Returns the value stored in the cloud of this SyncableDeveloperString. This value is only available when there is a conflict.

Returns:
value stored in the cloud.

getValue

java.lang.String getValue()
Returns the local value of this SyncableDeveloperString.

Returns:
local value of this SyncableDeveloperString.

setValue

void setValue(java.lang.String value)
Sets the value of this SyncableDeveloperString. This method is also meant to be used by the developer to set the desired value in case of a conflict before calling resolve().

Parameters:
value - the value to be set.

getCloudTimestamp

long getCloudTimestamp()
The time in which the cloud value of this element was set as the number of seconds elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.

Returns:
the time in which the cloud value of this element was set.

getTimestamp

long getTimestamp()
The time in which this element was set as the number of seconds elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.

Returns:
the time in which this element was set.

isSet

boolean isSet()
Returns whether or not the value of this SyncableDeveloperString has been set, and thus inserted into the GameDataMap.

Returns:
whether or not the value of this SyncableDeveloperString has been set.
